metadata.unit_type: Divisione Autotrasportabile AS (Semi-Motorized Infantry Division, North Africa Type)

narrative.title: Bologna Division - 1941Q1
narrative.unit_type: Divisione Autotrasportabile AS (Semi-Motorized Infantry Division, North Africa Type)
narrative.situation: Italian Divisione Autotrasportabile AS (Semi-Motorized Infantry Division, North Africa Type) deployed in North Africa during 1941Q1.
narrative.objectives: Semi-motorized infantry division conducting defensive and limited offensive operations in North African theater after suffering heavy casualties in British Operation Compass (December 1940-January 1941).
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

supply.notes: Supply situation degraded after Operation Compass. Division suffered heavily in British advance December 1940-January 1941. Critical shortages of all supplies.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Light tank battalion provides limited mobile firepower

supply_states.notes: Supply situation degraded after Operation Compass. Division suffered heavily in British advance December 1940-January 1941. Critical shortages of all supplies.
